sen.j: 京八流（きょうはちりゅう）は、伝説上の剣術流派。
sen.e: Kyohachiryu is a legendary school of swordsmanship.
Kyohachiryu is a legendary school of swordsmanship.
Kyohachiryu is a legendary school of swordsmanship.

sen.j: 平安時代末期に鬼一法眼が京都の鞍馬山で8人の僧侶に刀法を伝えたところを始祖として、現代まで伝わる全ての剣術の源流となったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the school's ancestral beginning is when Hogen KIICHI taught the way of the sword to eight Budhist monks on Mt. Kurama in the Heian period, and it is said to be the origians of all swordsmanship.

It is said that the school's ancestral beginning was when Hogen KIICHI taught the way of the sword to eight Budhist monks on Mt. Kurama in the Heian period, and it is said to be the origins of all swordsmanship.

It is said that the school's ancestral beginning was when Hogen KIICHI taught the way of the sword to eight Buddhist monks on Mt. Kurama in the end of the Heian period, and it is said to be the origins of all swordsmanship.

sen.j: 源義経が師事した流派という伝説もあり、様々な人物伝や伝記などの伝承もあるが、どれも具体的な物証などがなく、伝説の域を出ない。
sen.e: There is a legend that Yoshitsune MINAMOTO was a follower of this school, and there are many folklores such as stories on various characters and biographies related to the school but none has concrete evidence and do not go beyond being a legend.

There is a legend that Yoshitsune MINAMOTO was a follower of this school, and there are many folklores such as stories on various characters and biographies related to the school but none has concrete evidence and do not go beyond being a legend.

There is a legend that Yoshitsune MINAMOTO was a follower of this school, and there are many folklores such as stories on various characters and biographies related to the school but none has concrete evidence and do not go beyond being a legend.

sen.j: 吉岡憲法直元が開祖とする伝承もある。
sen.e: Another folklore says that Naomoto YOSHIOKA, who first used the title of Kenpo, is the founder.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: Another folklore says that Naomoto YOSHIOKA, who first used the title of Kenpo, is the founder.
Another folklore says that Naomoto YOSHIOKA, who first used the title of Kenpo, is the founder.

sen.j: その後戦国時代 (日本)末期から江戸時代初期の宮本武蔵と争った吉岡清十郎、吉岡伝七郎を京八流吉岡道場の達人と伝承もあるが、当の吉岡一門が断絶しており、吉岡一門と武蔵の私闘自体、文献の信用性が薄く検証性が乏しい。
sen.e: There are also folklores that say Seijuro YOSHIOKA and Denshichiro YOSHIOKA, who fought Musashi MIYAMOTO from the final days of Sengoku Period (period of warring states) to the beginning of the Edo period were the masters from the Kyohachiryu-school's Yoshioka-dojo hall, but it is not possible to determine the validity of such stories as the Yoshioka family and followers have become extinct and there are no trustworthy material to give light on the conflicts between the Yoshioka group and Musashi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: There are also folklores that say Seijuro YOSHIOKA and Denshichiro YOSHIOKA, who fought Musashi MIYAMOTO from the final days of Sengoku Period (period of warring states) to the beginning of the Edo period were masters from the Kyohachiryu-school's Yoshioka-dojo hall, but it is not possible to determine the validity of such stories as the Yoshioka family and followers have become extinct and there are no trustworthy materials to give light on the conflicts between the Yoshioka group and Musashi.

There are also folklores that say Seijuro YOSHIOKA and Denshichiro YOSHIOKA, who fought Musashi MIYAMOTO from the final days of Sengoku Period (period of warring states) to the beginning of the Edo period were masters from the Kyohachiryu-school's Yoshioka-dojo hall, but it is not possible to determine the validity of such stories as the Yoshioka family and followers have become extinct and there are no trustworthy materials to give light on the conflicts between the Yoshioka group and Musashi.

sen.j: 吉岡流の他、鞍馬流、中条流などが京八流に源流を持つとされるが、あくまで伝説上の剣術であり、実在が疑問視されている。
sen.e: Besides the Yoshiokaryu-school, Kuramaryu-school, Nakajoryu-school and some others are said to originate in Kyohachiryu-school, but it does not go beyond being a legendary school of swordsmanship and there are doubts as to whether it actually existed.

Besides the Yoshiokaryu-school, the Kuramaryu-school, Nakajoryu-school and some others are said to originate from the Kyohachiryu-school, but it does not go beyond being a legendary school of swordsmanship and there are doubts as to whether it actually existed.

Besides the Yoshiokaryu-school, the Kuramaryu-school, Nakajoryu-school and some others are said to originate from the Kyohachiryu-school, but it does not go beyond being a legendary school of swordsmanship and there are doubts as to whether it actually existed.

sen.j: 「剣術の源流」「始祖が鬼一法眼」という伝承そのものはポピュラーで、現代に至るまでさまざまな文学作品や漫画作品などの設定に用いられている。
sen.e: The school being "the origin of swordsmanship" and "its founder being Hogen KIICHI"are part of popular legends and numerous fictions and comics have been written based on them.
The school being "the origin of swordsmanship" and "its founder being Hogen KIICHI" are part of popular legends and numerous fictional accounts and comics have been written based on them.
The school being 'the origin of swordsmanship' and 'its founder being Hogen KIICHI' are part of popular legends and numerous fictional accounts and comics have been written based on them.
